website_summaries.verdict: A good way to make a large batch of sausage by hand in an efficient, quick manner.
pros: Comes in multiple design styles with single and dual gear options
Stuffing is easy thanks to the tilting mechanism that allows gravity to do the heavy work
cons: Too large to comfortably use for occasional use
Requires extra space on kitchen islands or counters

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality!
customer_reviews.text: I was originally impressed with this stuffer on its first use. However, during the second use stuffing summer sausage into the casings with the largest stuffing tube provided, the threaded rod that provides the down pressure began to strip out. After half of the meat in the stuffing container was in the casing the stuffer seized up!! I had to stuff the rest of my batch by hand. Metal shavings from the rod were visible on the stuffing plate, and the threads are stripped half way to the top. It seems that the stuffer could not handle the down pressure even when using the largest stuffing tube....
customer_reviews.author: Dalyn

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Sounded like a good brand, however its far from it. It could just be that it cant handle the 17mm casing for snack sticks. It was VERY difficult to crank, the handle felt like it was gonna snap cause its just a cheap pop medal, medal shavings everywhere while cranking, and after about 7lbs of snack sticks the cheap welded bead that guides the screw shaft and keeps it from spinning broke off and will not screw downward now.(you can see in pic where there is no longer a guide in screw shaft) I wouldnt recommend this unless u just want a cheap machine for thicker casings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it could be a great product. Cleaning is easy
customer_reviews.text: At first sight it is impressive! Using it is another story. Base is not built flat, so it rocks! Base is too small and cranking is hard so you need two people. If they had made the base slightly wider or put suction cup feet on, it could be a great product. Cleaning is easy. crank mount wing screw is cheaply threaded with course threads, making it impossible to take wobble out of handle. Will be modifying with small motor. Bought this to make the job easier! Two people to stuff sausage is not what i had in mind!
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: In looking over different suffers the common complaint was plastic gears that strip. Again this is all metal gears and stainless tub with a plastic seal on the piston and easy to clean. Stuffed 20 lbs by myself in a short time and took longer to clean up than stuff. Would buy again. Only problem is it was missing 1 rubber foot when I unpacked it that I have requested from customer service and am waiting for a response
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sausage stuffer!!
customer_reviews.text: This is really well-built and surprisingly sturdy for such a great price! I had been using the sausage extruder attachment on my Kitchen Aid stand mixer, and that was horrible. This stuffer is wonderful by comparison and requires very little physical effort. I've only stuffed maybe 40 lbs of sausage as yet, but it seems like it's going to be very durable over the years. There is only a very small amount of sausage left in the cannister when you've finished extruding, but enough to cook and taste test! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: James L T

customer_reviews.title: Oh well
customer_reviews.text: A buddy owns one and I must admit it works great..so I bit the bullet and brought one. After 5 pounds of a 30 pound batch of ground bear meat the unit broke down..there is a key way where the threaded rod rides up and down on..it broke..I would say that's the only place they chinzed on regarding workmanship.. Vivo is a great company. They were super attentive.
customer_reviews.author: bowman

customer_reviews.title: Failed after short time doing snack sticks.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 18 months ago - cranked less than 150 lbs of sausage through in that time, mostly in 10lb batches making 19mm snack sticks. The problem is there is no way to lubricate the shaft that the crank turns. I tried to force silicon into the area to provide some lubrication. Eventually, it developed some slop and the gears began to jump. Then it all came apart and bent the frame. The small snack stick size casing is tough to push through. I think this would work fine for brat size casing for a long time. However - if you are trying to do smaller casing this unit will fail.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kelso

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT but...
customer_reviews.text: Lacks stability. Until I went and got a large C-clamp and clamped it to the table, it was taking 2 people to stuff the meat sticks in the pic. With the clamp holding it down, it's a godsend for stuffing. Update: 2/16/2019 Went to make the 3rd batch of meat sticks with it today. Less than half way through the first fill of the stuffer, the frame and one of the upper pins securing bent, rendering it useless.

customer_reviews.title: Great, not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is easy to use and clean. Only complaint is the size of the elbow and tube combined mean a lot is left “in the barrel” that never makes it into a sausage. Therefore I will gladly use this for larger batches but will look for something with less leftovers and smaller for trial batches.
customer_reviews.author: BigWinston

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY

customer_reviews.title: Gears and threaded rod poor quality. Theads stripped on the third time using it!
customer_reviews.text: The meat container is well made and easy to clean and fill. The threaded rod and gear that drive the piston are made of to soft of material. The threads began to fail after stuffing about 20# of snack sticks. On my third time using stuffer, the threads galled half way down and I could hardly get it to retract out of the cylinder. I contacted VIVO and they told me I have to contact Amazon for parts because Amazon is who sold it. My recommendation, spend a little more and purchase a LEM stuffer. You can buy parts if need easily.

It was easy to assemble and it is easy to clean. It produces sauge very easy and my five year old loves helping and turning the handle. The gears are all metal so no plastic to break or wear out. I have made about a hundred pounds of sausage and hot dogs and it hasn't failed once.

product_meta.title: VIVO Sausage Stuffer Vertical Stainless Steel 3L/7lbs 5-7 Pound Meat Filler
feature_bullets: Metal construction - stainless steel cylinder and spout, as well as stable metal base and crank. All gears and pistons are also constructed of durable metal. This product complies with RoHS, is LFGB certified, and meets SGS food safety standards.
Airflow and filling - Piston includes an air release valve to allow air to escape and keep stuffer from overheating. The entire cylinder tilts back which allows for convenient filling.
Nozzles - 4 plastic nozzles included: 10 mm ( 0. 4 inch), 20 mm (0. 79 inch), 30 mm (1. 18 inch) and 40 mm (1. 57 inch)
Disassembly - disassembles in seconds for easy cleaning and convenient storage
One Year manufacturer - sturdy stuffer comes with a Limited 1-year manufacturer as well as friendly tech support to help with any questions or concerns.
